Balanceamento

O jogo foi feita para ser um 6vs6 (2 tanks, 2 dps e 2 suportes) com personagens variados em cada classe. Na mudan√ßa enorme (meme n√£o foi enorme) que a blizzard fez de tirar 1 dos tanks do jogo e transformar o jogo em um 5vs5 o balanceamento quebrou basicamente. Vou dar leves citadas para que players antigos ou com no√ß√£o de game entendam meu ponto. Primeiro veio o meta de snipers, j√° que agora n√£o tinha mais a possibilidade de Escudos diversos para proteger seus dps e suportes os snipers tomaram conta do jogo e basicamente tudo que acontecia era um sniper qualquer acabando com o time, e ganhava normalmente o melhor sniper muita das vezes, ent√£o vendo que o meta estava insuport√°vel para todos, j√° que os tanks n√£o conseguiam proteger seu time, os dps contra snipers bons ou melhores que eles tomavam surra a qlq dist√¢ncia, e os suportes como sempre chorando independente do meta (vou aprofundar nisso mais a frente) , a blizzard foi l√° e nerfou os snipers, e ent√£o surgiu o meta de bonecos voadores, ent√£o os bonecos que n√£o fossem hitscan basicamente antes j√° sofriam desvantagem desde os prim√≥rdios do jogo agora sofrem ainda mais (hitscan s√£o bonecos que voc√™ atira e o tiro pega na hora, j√° os que n√£o s√£o disparam proj√©teis que demoram a chegar no alvo selecionado) mas a pior parte desse meta n√£o √© essa, a pior parte √© que mesmo os hitscan sendo feitos pra impedir isso eles n√£o conseguem fazer isso contra players de alt√≠ssimo nivel j√° que o tank n√£o tem a capacidade de proteger seu time, a melhor op√ß√£o de um tank contra bonecos voadores √© dva, e sendo realista, poucos jogam de dva e ainda menos jogadores realmente sabem jogar com ela. E outro ponto importante, SUPORTES. Como os jogadores novos e os ruins n√£o sabiam como jogar de suporte a blizzard decidiu buffar todos eles a um ponto em que qualquer beb√™ consiga jogar, suportes hoje em dia tem mais capacidade de tankar que um dps, dar mais dano que um tank ou um dps e al√©m disso curar o time obviamente, e mesmo assim os suportes ainda tem a aud√°cia de dizer que a role deles √© fraca ou que a mercy merecia um buff. Suporte hoje em dia √© a role mais f√°cil de subir e ao mesmo tempo a mais forte do jogo, e isso n√£o seria ruim, o problema s√£o os suportes darem dano, cura, imortalidade, teleporte, stun, cancelar cura, terem as menores hitbox do jogo e al√©m disso tudo serem a role mais f√°cil de se jogar, com o menos n√≠vel de habilidade necess√°rio (muitos v√£o discordar mas a estat√≠sticas t√£o ai pra mostrar o oposto)

Skins e microtransa√ß√µes

Agora conseguir skins de gra√ßa √© extremamente dif√≠cil, horas de jogo e meses farmando passes e etc. Antes voc√™ conseguia todas de gra√ßa se quisesse. Passe caro e skins mais caras ainda.

Sistema de rank

Fizeram um sistema em que ou voc√™ perde 15 ou ganha 5 para subir ou descer de rank, sem n√∫meros vis√≠veis aos jogadores. Esse sistema facilitou muito upar de rank e antes o maior rank do br poss√≠vel e alcan√ß√°vel era mestre (deveria ter uns psicopatas de conseguiam grindar mesmo sem ter player at√© o gr√£o mestre mas duvido muito), mas pelo menos agora os brs conseguem alcan√ßar top 500 acho, mas em contrapartida os ranks est√£o inflados, jogadores que eu via no platina come√ßaram a cair nas minhas filas em mestre, obviamente afundando totalmente o jogo por contra pr√≥pria. Al√©m disso o sistema √© falho demais, j√° tive 5 vit√≥rias seguidas e consegui upar totais nada, isso tem haver com o seu mmr no momento de dar inicia a "md5" pelo visto mas n√£o posso confirmar nada. O matchmaking √© inexistente, o jogo vai colocar players as vezes que pegaram gr√£o mestre, mas atualmente mestre, contra players que na vida toda foram platina mas no overwatch 2 viraram diamante. E mesmo com tanto problema relaxa, o jogo sempre teve smurfs ainda na √©poca que era pago, agora tem ainda mais... N√£o que eu me importe, mas se voc√™ √© player novo se prepare pra ver um genji brincando contigo ou uma widow acabando com seu time.

Pra n√£o ser injusto...
Pontos positivos: Gameplay at√© √© divertida at√© voc√™ reparar o qu√£o quebrado o jogo est√° atualmente, da pra jogar com todos os amigos, gr√°fico daora, falas e personagens muito bem feitas, pra quem liga pra lore tem e √© divertidinha e tem bastante variedade de personagens e skins mas pena que players novos n√£o ter√£o acesso a tudo igual os antigos mas fazer oq n√©, o golpe ta ai cai quem quer.

I have 292 hours on my ingame account.

At first I purely intended to download the game, launch it, close it, and leave the bad review - because this game deserves the bad review. This awful company deserves the bad review. There is not an ounce of good will at play - at least, it's hard to see anything that might otherwise be considered good will as something other than public relations damage control because Blizzard has successfully pissed [i]everyone[/i] off. 

If it wasn't the way that they flat-out lied about the main selling point for Overwatch 2, the pointlessness of the "sequel", the pandering to Chinese censors, the cheap, disgusting """diversity""", or the abysmally greedy monetization, then it was the sexual assault stories.

What's here is morally, ethically and financially [i]reprehensible.[/i] I have seen so much failure in my time - I've played so many damn games. I've tuned in to every juicy bit of live service game drama that I can because I don't want to make the same mistakes. But nobody - not EA, not Riot - nobody has earned the sheer ire that Blizzard has, and Overwatch, not Diablo Immortal, is the poster child for why.

For you see, I DID intend to just log on, log off, and leave a thumbs down telling you to stay away because I'm "doing my part" in bottoming out the review score. But I really did have fond memories of when the game was new. When Blizzard wasn't turning every character some form of gay (oversexualizing in a title meant for children!) to appeal to twitter folx. When Blizzard wasn't lying about what the game had or was going to have. When Blizzard was putting forth an earnest effort, and it felt meaningful. 

Yeah, the design was never perfect. The challenge of having to decide if you would sacrifice a game-changing ultimate in order to swap to a counterpick was always a stupid, stupid challenge. It was definitely not balanced. It was often infuriating. But it had soul. It did feel great. The first couple years of Overwatch were its best, but I can't revisit that and neither can you.

Now the game is "free". They want to sell you $15 for "story missions". If the free event mission is anything to go by, you really shouldn't bother. It's just a few kinds of robots that you blow up over and over, and it just feels... hollow. I was thinking about this as I was playing, thinking "what would they have to do differently in order for me, a bitter former player, to enjoy this?" I'm not sure, but the answer WASN'T to tediously blast through a bunch of generic-looking enemies with the same kit that I was accustomed to using in pvp. 

This is at the heart of what makes Blizzard the worst game development studio on the face of the earth: It's their legacy of taking great games and utterly [i]ruining[/i] them. They ruined Diablo. They ruined Warcraft. They ruined Hearthstone! They could have kept Heroes of the Storm alive, but they decided that they didn't care about it once they realized esports wasn't bringing in the big bucks (shame, too - HotS is a phenomenal MOBA and I hated watching the queue times increase). This is a company that cares more about "diversity, inclusion and equity" than about making good games or telling good stories. Don't you just feel so [i]represented?[/i] 

But while Blizzard deserves the thumbs down for everything that they've trashed, the spirit of a recommendation of Overwatch 2 should stand on the merits of Overwatch 2 - and Overwatch 2 is a mutant wearing the skin of something that was once good, but now wants to sell you $12000 worth of premium skins. 

The best part about Bobby Kotick bringing Overwatch to Steam is that now all of Steam gets to see what we think of this.
Better go play Team Fortress 2
Un saludo a curi ow

I mainly play Competitive but with the way the mode was/is handled, I find it increasingly difficult to continue playing it. In Overwatch 1, you could jump into a ranked match and have a great quality match, over and over again. You'd be lucky to have back to back quality matches in Overwatch 2. If you like Quick Play matches, you can try Overwatch 2 Competitive. Also known as Quick Play 2.

I genuinely want to like this game but I can't. I really can't. From the broken PVE promises to the inept developers, to the non existent balance and ball breakingly bad metas, to the greedy monetisation, to the awful competitive mode it's just not fun. I bought this game originally all the way back in 2016 and loved it up until my subscription on my ps4 ran out. Came back years later to play with friends in 2021, good times with friends but on my own it was awful. Now in 2023 i come back one last time to say that the 400+ hours i put into this game was NOT WORTH IT WHATSOEVER. Monetization is everywhere, heroes are constantly unbalanced, and the community is only full of bad thoughts. The last straw was the cancellation of everything this game was built off for pitty story missions, im out. Don't play this game if you value your time and humanity

Eu amo e odeio esse jogo.

Jogo essa  b0sta desde 2017, mais de 1500 horas perdidas nesse lixo. Consigo claramente falar como esse jogo √© desbalanceado e os players completamente limitados e geralmente carregados para o elo em que est√£o. Esse jogo consegue te estressar em QuickPlay por causa de players completamente sequ3lados, imagine em uma Ranked.

A pior coisa que fizeram nesse jogo foi tirar as Lootboxes. A unica gra√ßa dos eventos al√©m do "conteudo novo" (mesmo evento reciclado a 394 anos) era farmar as Lootbox para pegar as skins novas, tiraram o unico prazer de jogar para transformar o jogo em um farm de dinheiro com skins ruins e passes de batalha piores ainda.

O jogo que foi GOTY em 2016 decaiu tanto e perdeu tantos players que tiveram que apelar para uma sequencia desastrosa, tirando tudo que era minimamente interessante e divertido de seu antecessor. 

Eu amo esse jogo, amo o universo criado, amo a lore, os personagens e a gameplay variada que me divertiu por muitas horas(mais estresse do que divers√£o), mas depois que a Activision Blizzard matou ele pela primeira vez e agora matando a sua continuidade, eu infelizmente perdi a esperan√ßa de que esse jogo ir√° para frente igual bem no inicio.

Espero e tor√ßo que com a compra pela Microsoft, esse jogo consiga voltar ao menos  10% do que ele j√° foi em seu tempo de gloria.

Overwatch has got to be one of my favorite games of all time. It has a diverse roster, unique gamemodes, and fun gunfights. Or well, it used to. Now you are forced into picking boring characters that fit into the meta in order to not get yelled at by your team. The gamemodes are antifun garbage where you sit on the the slowest possible fucking objective while it inches toward a checkpoint. Now gunfights consist of which team has more CC and dying instantly while playing a 600 health character because of a anti-healing grenade. The Overwatch team seems like it had a genuine desire to make a better game when they came out with Overwatch 2. Except all of the main components of what was supposed to make it new have been flushed down the fucking toilet because the Blizzard CEOs wanted more money. It's honestly sad to see the state of the game now and to also have seen the state of it back then. Great game though

Paid PVE?
So I was about to return to Overwatch (had around 900 hours in Ow1) then quit after we got the news that PVE is canceled (also I preordered OW2)

When I saw that the PVE now costs money, I was shocked TBH, like seriously, there is a Battle Pass, Paid Heroes, and the Cosmetics are so damn expensive and now you are monetizing even the game mods??

Not only was the promised PVE reduced in content by 90%, but also canceled after tons of people got hyped because this was the point of OW2 and trusted Blizzard and bought OW2, only to be lied to after.

So back to the current time , I saw that the game comes to Steam - got a bit of "meh" maybe il try it, then I saw the PVE (reduced ofc) and was like, alright il give it a go for the old time sake, and THEN I see that it is paid content???? (and I reminded myself again - never trust Blizzard) , and I promised myself to never give any more $$ after many products that lacked the promise and didn't deliver (Warcraft , Diablo 4 , OW2..) Never again am I giving any more money to Blizzard, and this was the final nail in the coffin proving that.

Many people pre-ordered and have been lied to about what is to come to this game.
I'll keep it nice and short. It's a great game with lots of flaws but nothing like it.

[h1] TLDR: Don't play Overwatch 2 when TF2 exist
[u]To put it shortly, they don't care about YOU as a player. They just want their filthy hands on your money. You can really see it once you play the game and get to know it. The developers are no different to Destiny 2.[/u]

> Horrible balance changes.
   > Kiriko, Soj, Soldier/Cassidy, Mercy still run the game.
   > Takes forever for maps to rebalance.
> They want your money and it is obvious that they are desperate.
   > Battlepasses, Currency, Skins can cost *20 dollars*.
   > They have their game on steam when TF2 is also on there. TF2 is a greater game and was the older hero/class shooter than Overwatch. Matter of fact, some of Overwatch was inspired by TF2.
> Toxic and arrogant (know-it-all) fan base. You can obviously tell from TikToks/Media (Sorry flatz). From my experience (and from others) a *small* fraction of the player base will arrogantly dismiss any takes they disagree with. (What I mean by this are the people who would say "Learn how to read!" "Your not GM/Top500 so you don't count!" "Your arguments are fallacious and incoherent!")
   > Note: Toxicity does rarely occur in the game, but it is very noticeable in Plat/Diamond/Masters. NOT ALL OF OW2 ARE TOXIC, however, compared to TF2, OW2 is more intolerant toward expression.
 > They cancel PVE, but bring it back in desperation...
   > MVM from TF2 is much more worth your time. You could get loot and money (only some) by playing PVE in TF2. It stood for years at this point to laugh at OW2.

I am feeling unlucky, and that a random YouTuber, or Streamer will come and look at this. 

Maybe you should prepare to be embarrassed. I would be excited to hear your thoughts on the game. Shouldn't you stop supporting such a company? I know I am not going to support a rotten company like Blizzard. At this rate, Overwatch is a serious insult to gaming, and I think you know well about that.

This game was one of the first games I ever properly played all the way back in 2016. From that point it instantly became one of my favourites and continued until this "new game" which was meant to bring new content. What you get in return is a product that is swamped with ¬£20 skins, charging for content that was ultimately scrapped (PvE content) and when that does launch the actual game play is worse if not to the same level as FREE content in OW1. Play the free experience if u want but I heavily encourage you to not spend money on this game.

[b]Monetizaci√≥n[/b]
Al nivel Call Of Duty (recordemos que estos dos pertenecen a la misma empresa), recuerdo que en las primeras temporadas ten√≠as que grindear una cantidad est√∫pida de tiempo para desbloquear a un personaje, o evidentemente ten√≠as la opci√≥n de DESEMBOLSAR para obtenerlos instant√°neamente o como no olvidar cuando sacaron la skin de Kiriko de la colaboraci√≥n de One Punch Man donde literalmente agarraron su skin base, le pusieron un color s√≥lido negro a su vestido y le pusieron la peluca peor modelada y m√°s apresurada que has visto en tu vida, unos completos genios del marketing. V√≠ opiniones  en otros sitios pidiendo el regreso de las loot boxes, yo no comparto esta opini√≥n pues es totalmente innecesario (mirar el estado de Apex Legends y de otros juegos de la historia que usaron este sistema como su modelo principal) y alimenta la ludopat√≠a, ya que se tomaron la molestia de copiar el ya copiado por todos pase de batalla, a lo mejor pueden llegar a copiar el estilo de monetizar que tiene por ejemplo Riot con en el LOL, u otro much√≠simo mejor.

[b]Balance[/b]
El balance es un completo INSULTO A LA INTELIGENCIA HUMANA, doble escudo, la matriz de DVA, los supports son lo m√°s OP y falto de habilidad que he visto en alg√∫n videojuego; overhealing, superviviencia extrema, capacidad de one shot (algunos, los otros igual te pueden burstear), movilidad exagerada, totalmente absurdo y como evidentemente es una clase que requiere much√≠sima habilidad han sacado a un nuevo personaje que tira TORRETAS QUE TE CURAN (XDXDXD), s√≥lo por si se te hace dif√≠cil curar mientras haces literalmente cualquier otra cosa, los parches son m√°s LEEEENTOOOSS que tu padre regresando a tu casa despu√©s de ir por los cigarros, as√≠ que si algo sale mal te vas a tener que esperar como bobo hasta que saquen el siguiente parche, porque hay que estar ANALIZANDO TODO UN MES ENTERO para determinar al final que la ulti de Sombra no debe destruir el arbolito de Lifeweaver, entre muchas otras cosas, en resumen: que asco m√°s grande.

[b]PVE[/b]
Una de las razones de la existencia de OW2 era la salida del PVE, hace muchos meses anunciaron que hab√≠a sido cancelaron, pero al final que todo era un simple chascarrillo, he visto otras opiniones que dicen que el contenido que ofrece es una completa basura, no comparto la opini√≥n porque simplemente no lo he jugado, porque no soy lo suficientemente est√∫pido para pagar el precio para un modo PVE de un juego que tiene una cantidad exagerada de problemas.

[b]¬øCompetitivo?[/b]
XD ¬øOverwatch League? No s√© de qu√© me hablas.

[b]Casual[/b]
Si eres un casual, prep√°rate porque en las partidas normales, si el otro equipo va ganando, los POBRES de MENTALIDAD y FRACASADOS de tus compa√±eros de equipo se van a salir de la partida sin ninguna amonestaci√≥n por parte del sistema del juego, para este caso es mejor jugar con amigos, incluso as√≠ si es que no cubres las 5 casillas del equipo, se van a salir, igualmente es est√∫pido que si no tienes amigos no puedas disfrutar en su totalidad las casuals, imag√≠nate c√≥mo lo deben pasar los main support.

[b]Puntos positivos[/b]
Lo poco que trae, como las mec√°nicas de los personajes, son divertidas y tienen su propia identidad, algunos mapas no est√°n mal, tambi√©n que es el juego m√°s dif√≠cil s√≥lo en lo que respecta aim, as√≠ que si quieres un reto de aim puedes probarlo si es que logras sobrevivir de todos los puntos anteriores, principalmente balance, pues al final todos los errores de salida de OW2 se vienen arrastrando hasta la actualidad.
